io.github.dalayach.Print_tools

Class Build_strings

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.dalayach.Print_tools.Helper_functions
      • io.github.dalayach.Print_tools.Build_strings
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    String_printer

    class Build_strings
extends Helper_functions
    Builds Strings using precalculated values and String.format(). Will also print output to console.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      Build_strings()

    • Method Detail

      • print_center_justified

        public java.lang.String print_center_justified(boolean borders,
                                               int expected_size,
                                               java.lang.String... messages)
        Will print and return a sequence of Strings that is center-justified. Each will be separated with borders if the boolean parameter borders is true.
        Parameters:
        borders - boolean that is true if borders are to be included, and false if not. Note that borders will add to the column width, so a sequence of Strings WITH borders will be longer than a sequence of Strings WITHOUT borders.
        expected_size - int containing the expected_size (given by the user, but we will check if it's correct)
        messages - sequence of Strings (or just a String array, depending how you wish to use it) that holds the data to be printed out as a String
        Returns:
        the newly created String that is now center-justified

      • print_center_justified

        public java.lang.String print_center_justified(int expected_size,
                                               java.lang.String... messages)
        Will print and return a sequemce of Strings that is center-justified and separated with borders.
        Parameters:
        expected_size - int containing the expected_size (given by the user, but we will check if it's correct)
        messages - sequence of Strings (or just a String array, depending how you wish to use it) that holds the data to be printed out as a String
        Returns:
        the newly created String that is now center-justified with borders

        messages - sequence of Strings (or just a String array, depending how you wish to use it) that holds the data to be printed out as a String

        the newly created String that is now right-justified
